reviewText: I put this film on & though I'd be in for a wild ride after the openeing "jackhammer to the face" scene, alas, it turned into a story of a drug addict simply out of his mind. The plot (was there one?) had more holes than I can count on my fingers (if only I had more fingers!). When a movie uses the typical "one year earlier" and "one year later" movie conventions, you know there isn't much to look forward to. But, you may ask, why would anyone concentrate on plot-lines when the movie is titled "jackhammer massacre". Well, if I were to give you the attention deficit disorder review, it would be as follows: druggie kills man with jackhammer, flash back 1 year, show that he once had a job and did recreational drugs with a firend, flash forward 1 year and he's a druggie security guard for some non-descript warehouse, nothing much happens up until this time (which about now clocks in at over 1 hour), then the film comes to a close with people coming to clear out the warehouse he works at (this includes his concerned sister). Now that their are people in his midst at the warehouse, the killing begins, but at this point, you just want it to end, even if the body count rises. I would have been better off sorting my laundry or picking at unhealed scabs than to have watched this (sigh). What a fool I am!- to think, being a horror movie fan, that I could get some enjoyment. (It wasn't even "Bad" in a good way).

Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay alot of people give it 1 star or less because they think it's just a movie about a junkie killing people.Well the main character was not always an addict he had a good job & a good friend,but as a businessman who puts in long hours he dabbled with a little bit of speed.Then him & his buddy go to a cook house & get turned on to some good glass crystal meth.Then they get shot up with a little bit of Pcp and then his buddy starts foaming at the mouth and eventually dies from his overdose.The main character who was a good businessman with a brand new Dodge Viper has been reduced to living in a hole in the wall shop(literally)because he called 911 gave em his name then smashed the phone and left his buddy on the ground to die.The cops and his boss keep calling him,hes scared obviously so he quits and disappears.Then 1 year later it jumps and you see him all messed up,the story real short is he owes a dealer so the dealer whips up a killer hot shot with one of those Ron Popeil flavor injector spikes(wide gauge needle) filled with Heroin Meth & PCP  to kill him with a deadly overdose.Next thing you know it turns him into superjunkie. He picks up a jackhammer at the shop he lives in(hes a security guard) and kills the dealer & his muscle man. Then he takes all their dope and shoots that cocktail constantly(which should kill you on the first try,let alone shooting an ounce of dope in your veins several times a day) Next the building he's living in and working as a security guard gets sold,so the owner tells the kid to leave.This kids hallucinating badly & his dead buddy is talking to him telling him to kill the people before they lock him up.So he kills the owner of the building.His sister comes with her girlfriend to give him money & he takes her hostage(she pops up in the end) and the next day the cleaning crew comes to pack & inventory everything and 1 by 1 they get jackhammered or shot up with the deadly cocktail.A former addict/dealer that's on the cleaning crew gets dosed and becomes a superjunkie just like the other guy.It's funny cuz they both shoot up before the fight(like touching gloves in boxing before the match) I wont give away the ending,i probably gave it all away anyways,but it's a review in depth.The movie needs to get some positive support,it's a low budget flick but the kills,the blood,the gore,the drugs all look super realistic.The story is somewhat believable except for the fact that this kid is impervious to overdosing.The story of how drugs can bring you from the top to the bottom fast is believable. The dead guy talking to him in his head,the people that he thinks are coming to get him...that's just the guilt of the kid for leaving his friend to die on the ground.Plus he keeps injecting in the same spot(which never made sense to me) and it is all infected and nasty looking,it looks like he has a knee for an elbow and forearm.That's why you never want to inject in the exact same spot,nor sharing needles.I will say this i'm no stranger to any of the crap in the movie but i have never touched a needle nor would i ever,too much risk.I would recommend this movie if you want too see a shocking true to life horror movie about a psychotic drug addict killing for revenge & free dope.
Title: N/A

reviewText: 'Jackhammer Massacre' is another low budget direct-to-DVD film that shows how easy it is in this age of digital video for any yahoo to pick up a camera and make a movie.  There's a lot wrong with this film but there are actually a couple of nuggets here that show that the makers of it might actually have a little talent.The story goes something like this:  Jack is a well-to-do business man who starts in on some hardcore drugs.  His best friend dies from an overdose and Jack spirals into heavy drug use and ends up a more-or-less homeless junkie.  He sleeps on a matress in an old auto shop as a night security guard.  He does drugs all the time and eventually starts hallucinating.  He sees his dead best friend.  This hallucination tells him that "Everyone is out to get you, so you better kill them before they get the chance"...or something along those lines.  So Jack picks up a jackhammer and starts killing everyone.The acting is overall pretty poor; not the worst ever(that title goes to 'Ghost Lake')but enough to make you cringe.  The editing and camerawork seem to be decent enough.  Its nothing polished or professional, but its done well enough to not distract.  The script is pretty obvious:  you know how things are gonna end up a few minutes into the film.  The dialogue written wasn't too bad but some of the acting in the film makes it sound terrible.  There is a good bit of gore, some of it hits and some of it misses, but again its nothing really amazing.There are some decent parts to 'Jackhammer Massacre' though.  The drug use scenes are very realistic and pretty intense.  Actually, the whole drug storyline would've made a much better film if the filmmakers would've stuck with it instead of turning it into a horror flick.  But the main thing that bothered me was the filmmaker's need to have every male in the film topless at some point.  I swear that there's not two minutes that go buy that there isn't another topless dude running around for no reason.  Its actually more disturbing than the gore.Overall, I can't really recommend 'Jackhammer Massacre'.  The beginning of the film centered on Jack's drug use is very well done but is quickly scrapped for yet another lame B-movie horror plot.  Gorehounds might like some of the scenes but its not anything they haven't seen before.  But I guess if you dig topless men running around, then this one's for you.

reviewText: JACHAMMER aka Jackhammer Massacre , Director's Cut.Written and Directed by Joe Castro.Starring Aaron Gaffey, Rachel & Rob Rotten and Joe Haggerty.This is an amazing ride, It has stuff YOU have never seen in Horror, Before !The acting was all believable, The story very unique.There were tributes to Laserblast, Leaving Las Vegas and American Werewolf in London.Special effects were something like Davids, Cronenberg and Lynch.Let's discuss the relationship of a man and his Jackhammer. The tool looks real and makes hamburger helper out of a lot of victim's body parts. While watching it,Got a weird sensation of Déjà vu and it's because of Charles Band handling of Laserblast. This movie showed you don't pick on someone with Issues or Aliens will make Him KICK UR ARSE !Some scenes,should be spoiler warnings; The dueling Land Of The Giants hypodermic appendages/ screw driver brain surgery/ and never unplug your extension cord, Too funny.Joe Castro and Steven Escobar  should be given more money to make the film there effects can imagine, But JACKHAMMER is a good start. Oh,yeah, Great Anti-Drug message too, In case the MPAA is reading this, LOL.
summary: From the CHARLES BAND of our generation !

The bad guy does not believe that.  They take some stuff, but the bad guy decides he wants to stay and check out a boom box.  Jack comes to and is strong enough to jackhammer the bad guy in the mouth and destroy his face.Jack continues to be heavy into shooting himself up and kills more people.Film contains heavy simulated drug use, foul language, graphic violence and female nudity.This film is garbage and I do not care to see it again.  I do not like films that try to glorify drug use.

reviewText: When I decided to start reviewing movies in a big way on this website, I told myself that I would go out of my way to watch plenty of zero budget flicks. You know, the stuff that goes straight to DVD. The stuff made by a couple of guys in their backyards, shot on video most likely, and financed with credit cards. I figured doing so might possibly help out a budding filmmaker, maybe give a guy with a smidgen of talent an extra boost he or she needed to get a shot at making a real movie. It's ridiculous, I know, to think that some hack reviewer on this site could assist someone in this way, but that's what I thought. Who knows? Maybe that person would see my good review and take heart. Or maybe he would see a bad review and learn how to improve their next film. Those days, my friends, are long gone, lost in a sea of bad movies watched through increasingly bleary eyes. I've seen so many crudfests that I can't watch them anymore. I started seeking out big budget blockbusters, not because they're great, but because the production values and better acting (among other things) washed the bad taste of movies like "Jackhammer Massacre" out of my mouth."Jackhammer Massacre," sometimes referred to as simply "Jackhammer," is a low budget crudfest directed by some guy named Joe Castro. His forte, according to the Internet Movie Database, is in special effects. It's the only area where "Jackhammer" succeeds. All else is dross wrapped in a disturbing patina I'm not allowed to mention on this site. Sorry. Anyway, the film doesn't start out that way. It actually begins as homage to Nancy Reagan's "Just Say No" campaign as we watch a rich, smart yuppie named Jake (Aaron Gaffey) descend into the absolute madness of drug addiction. He starts his real decline by going to a drug den with a friend, shooting up junk with a girl sporting a bad Bettie Page coif, and then watching his pal die a painful death. The demise of his friend pushes Jackie over the edge, and before we know it he's lost everything expect an oozing, puckering sore on his arm. Jackie, not smart enough to let this festering wound heal, continues to shove smack into this seeping hole every chance he gets. Yuck. And since he's lost everything he's got, our hero is reduced to living in a storage facility crammed full of all sorts of junk. He also owes bad people a lot of money.One day these bad people track Jake down and shoot him up with an overdose that should kill him. Instead, it turns him into a murderous thug. Jake arms himself with a jackhammer he finds in the storage facility (How convenient!) and proceeds to wreak bloody havoc on all who enter his orbit. And, amazingly enough, you'd be surprised at how many people show up at this out of the way storage facility! It's like the Interstate runs right through the building as the drug dealers, the owner of the place, and a cleaning crew all die horribly at the hands of the drug crazed Jake. As soon as Jake dispatches someone with a jackhammer blade through the mouth or some other orifice (!!), the next victim ambles in for his or her punishment. Oddly enough, no one seems to hear the jackhammer pounding away inside this small building, nor do they have the presence of mind to just run outside. It's not like the jackhammer runs on portable power; we can all clearly see the cord running out of the tool. Oh well. After Jake murders a lot of people, he meets his match on the roof of the storage facility. The conclusion is taken right from the end of "Halloween"."Jackhammer Massacre" is an exceedingly dumb film. The acting is comparable to a kindergarten play, the viewer gets whiplash jouncing over the numerous plot holes in the script, and people do stuff that defies logic. The one plus, and the thing that gives this film two stars instead of one, is the gore. Jake pounds body parts into mush with that jackhammer, and Castro doesn't spare the sauce showing us the carnage. It doesn't always look totally realistic, but it's close enough to garner some praise. Perhaps the oddest element of the film is what I said above, what I can't mention on this site. How do I say it without saying it? Hmmm. Well, all the guys in the production seem to lumber around without shirts on. Most of them strip down to their undies. And then there's the way that these guys die. One chap takes the jackhammer blade in the mouth in what has to be a statement about...well...you know. Then there's the shot of the jackhammer blade in the girl's "posterius". Oops! Something sinister is going on here. Either someone has a problem with syag or someone just finds it funny to work a yag subplot into a slasher film (wink wink on those backwards words, eh?). Give "Jackhammer Massacre" a watch, if you dare, and see what you think.To be fair, Castro's film isn't the worst low budget clunker I've watched. I think back to the days when I perused shot on video dreck from Sub Rosa Productions and realize "Jackhammer Massacre" is far better than almost anything I saw from that company. I'm still giving this two stars, however, due to the myriad problems outlined above as well as the fact that it's just not that original of an idea. Also, Lionsgate didn't do a decent job with the DVD. The picture doesn't look that great, it's full frame, and the only significant extra is a rather bland commentary track with Castro and a few of the cast members. In short, I can't really recommend this movie. There's just not enough here to warrant a viewing.
summary: Odd subplot for a slasher, hmmm?

reviewText: This must be one of the most unpleasant horror films I've sat through in quite some time.  It depicts extensive drug use and its ugly aftermath, and it centers on one down on his luck guy named Jack who went from successful businessman to wasted junkie and I'm uncertain whether the director is trying to make an anti-drug statement or is simply showing us this for pure shock value.  The drug-taking scenes are harrowing, more so than the gory scenes when Jack goes bunkers and starts dispatching everyone with the jackhammer of the film's title.  The first half of the film is fine, and Aaron Gaffey's performance is believable and dedicated, it's the second half that falters, where we are introduced to a bunch of awfully acted characters that are there only to be massacred and unfortunately the lack of suspense adds to the tedium and pointlessness of it all.  The special effects are good though, and some will make you cringe (Jack's infected arm is barf-inducing).  Ultimately, the film is not as bad as most people say it is, as any horror flick that can make you feel like taking a shower afterwards must be doing something right, but with a more creative script this could have been a lot better.  For hardcore completists only.

reviewText: I purchased this DVD because of the word Massacre in the title! Being a huge fan of The Texas Chainsaw Massacre movies, I thought this might be really good. The box says.. Move over Leatherface..Here comes The Jackhammer Massacre. In my opinion, No movie can compare itself to the Texas Chainsaw Massacre movies, much less Leatherface! However I bought it and was a bit disappointed. The movie is a bit boring at times but did contain good death scenes. The best thing about the movie was the gore. It centers around a man named Jack who's badly addicted to drugs. Being so messed up by drugs, Jack believes that everyone is out to get him and kill him. He takes revenge on people by killing them with a jackhammer which I admit is "different" and a refreshing change. Overall, not a bad movie but not as good as I expected. It's worth renting if you are curious about it. There ARE worse horror movies out there.

reviewText: What can I say about this movie but it was not that bad. The story line is pretty good. It takes a well to do business man downward spiral into drugs hallucinations and murder. The effects are ok to good at times, the acting is ok  to good also. It will leave you feeling sick at times because of the over the edge drug use that the main character goes through. Do not expect  top of the line script and movie production but this film does offer something. It has that weirdness that I like in a film with a not so bad script. Believe me I seen my share of stinkers. I would almost give it 4 four stars except for some of it B-movie type productions. Try it out I was really surprise how good this film was. I wonder if the director had some money to make this film it probaly would been a five star possibly.

reviewText: First of all, this movie is a Lions Gate Film, its a low budget flick, but pretty good, but if you're only into main stream horror movies..then you probably won't like this movie. But for those of you that can sit through a low budget B horror movie  without complaining that "the acting isn't the greatest", or "this effect was lame", or "that doesn't make any sense!" Then read on...The movie is about a down on his luck guy who gets involved with some heavy drugs, and the story follows him as he slips further and further into insanity from the heavy "crap" he's on...he's homeless, he has no money, and owes some bigtime drug dealers money. Eventually, they get tired of his excuses and decide to inject him with some "stuff", that's suppose to kill him. Well, unfortunately for them, it doesn't kill him, it only makes him stronger (and a helluva lot crazier), he goes on a murdering spree of anyone who gets in his way, with the help of his dead friend, who overdosed on drugs. Ending in, well, a jackhammer massacre, a jackhammer being his weapon of choice.There's a great amount of gore in this movie, for all of you gore freaks (like me), and the plot makes sense if you watch the movie, and not bitch the whole time about it being low budget. Sure, the acting's not the greatest, but its definitely not the worse. The main character actually plays a nutcase rather well.For a movie I've never heard of, before buying it for $2.00, It was well worth the price. Give the movie a chance, and watch it all the way through before shooting it down just because its a low budget flick.
Title: N/A
